member.name: T:CSharpCAD.ValidationException
member.summary: Thrown by internal validation checks.

member.name: T:CSharpCAD.Geom2
member.summary: Represents a 2D geometry consisting of an array of sides.

member.name: P:CSharpCAD.Geom2.Is2D
member.summary: Is this a 2D geometry object?

member.name: P:CSharpCAD.Geom2.Is3D
member.summary: Is this a 3D geometry object?

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom2.#ctor
member.summary: Empty constructor.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom2.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{CSharpCAD.Vec2})
member.summary: Create a new 2D geometry from the given points.
member.remarks: The direction (rotation) of the points is not relevant, as the points can define a convex or a concave polygon. The geometry must not self intersect, i.e. the sides cannot cross.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom2.#ctor(CSharpCAD.Vec2[])
member.summary: Create a new 2D geometry from the given points.
member.remarks: The direction (rotation) of the points is not relevant, as the points can define a convex or a concave polygon. The geometry must not self intersect, i.e. the sides cannot cross.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom2.Equals(CSharpCAD.Geom2)
member.summary: Check if this geometry is equal to the given geometry.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom2.op_Equality(CSharpCAD.Geom2,CSharpCAD.Geom2)
member.summary: Check if this vector is equal to the given vector.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom2.op_Inequality(CSharpCAD.Geom2,CSharpCAD.Geom2)
member.summary: Check if this vector is not equal to the given vector.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom2.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Standard C# override.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom2.GetHashCode
member.summary: Standard C# override.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom2.ToString
member.summary: Standard C# override.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom2.IsNearlyEqual(CSharpCAD.Geom2)
member.summary: Used mostly for testing.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom2.ApplyTransforms
member.summary: Apply the transforms of the given geometry.
member.remarks: NOTE: This function must be called BEFORE exposing any data. See ToSides().

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom2.BoundingBox
member.summary: Measure the min and max bounds of the given (geom2) geometry.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom2.Clone
member.summary: Return a clone of this geometry.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom2.MeasureEpsilon
member.summary: Measure the epsilon of this geometry object.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom2.ToOutlines(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create the outline(s) of the given geometry.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom2.Reverse
member.summary: Reverses the given geometry so that the sides are flipped in the opposite order.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom2.ToPoints
member.summary: Produces an array of points from the given geometry.
member.remarks: NOTE: The points returned do NOT define an order. Use toOutlines() for ordered points.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom2.Transform(CSharpCAD.Mat4)
member.summary: Transform this geometry using the given matrix.
member.remarks: This is a lazy transform of the sides, as this function only adjusts the transforms. The transforms are applied when accessing the sides via ToSides().

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom2.Validate
member.summary: Determine if this object is a valid geom2.
member.remarks:
Checks for closedness, self-edges, and valid data points.
**If the geometry is not valid, an exception will be thrown with details of the geometry error.**

member.name: T:CSharpCAD.Geom3
member.summary: Represents a new 3D geometry composed of polygons.

member.name: P:CSharpCAD.Geom3.Is2D
member.summary: Is this a 2D geometry object?

member.name: P:CSharpCAD.Geom3.Is3D
member.summary: Is this a 3D geometry object?

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom3.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Collections.Generic.List{CSharpCAD.Vec3}})
member.summary: Construct a new 3D geometry from a list of points.
member.remarks: The list of points should contain sub-arrays, each defining a single polygon of points. In addition, the points should follow the right-hand rule for rotation in order to define an external facing polygon.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom3.#ctor
member.summary: Internal constructor. Public for testing use only.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom3.#ctor(CSharpCAD.Poly3[],CSharpCAD.Mat4,System.Nullable{CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Color},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Internal constructor. Public for testing use only.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom3.Equals(CSharpCAD.Geom3)
member.summary: Check if this geometry is equal to the given geometry.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom3.op_Equality(CSharpCAD.Geom3,CSharpCAD.Geom3)
member.summary: Check if this vector is equal to the given vector.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom3.op_Inequality(CSharpCAD.Geom3,CSharpCAD.Geom3)
member.summary: Check if this vector is not equal to the given vector.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom3.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Standard C# override.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom3.GetHashCode
member.summary: Standard C# override.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom3.ToString
member.summary: Standard C# override.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom3.IsNearlyEqual(CSharpCAD.Geom3)
member.summary: Used mostly for testing.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom3.ApplyTransforms
member.summary: Apply the transforms of the given geometry.
member.remarks: NOTE: This function must be called BEFORE exposing any data. See toPolygons.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom3.MeasureEpsilon
member.summary: Measure the epsilon value for this geometry object.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom3.Clone
member.summary: Return a full clone of this geometry.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom3.Invert
member.summary: Invert this geometry, transposing solid and empty space.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom3.BoundingBox
member.summary: Return the (min, max) BoundingBox of this geometry.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom3.ToPoints
member.summary: Return this geometry as a list of points, after applying transforms.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom3.ToPolygons
member.summary: Produces an array of polygons from this geometry, after applying transforms.
member.remarks: The returned array should not be modified as the polygons are shared with the geometry.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom3.Transform(CSharpCAD.Mat4)
member.summary: Add a transformation to this geometry.
member.remarks: This is done in a lazy fashion, only affecting the internal transforms vector.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Geom3.Validate
member.summary: Determine if the given object is a valid 3D geometry.
member.remarks:
Checks for valid data structure, convex polygon faces, and manifold edges.
**If the geometry is not valid, an exception will be thrown with details of the geometry error.**

member.name: T:CSharpCAD.Geometry
member.summary: Abstract class currently joining Geom2 and Geom3.

member.name: P:CSharpCAD.Geometry.Is2D
member.summary: Is this a 2D geometry object?

member.name: P:CSharpCAD.Geometry.Is3D
member.summary: Is this a 3D geometry object?

member.name: T:CSharpCAD.Poly3
member.summary: Represents a convex 3D polygon.
member.remarks: The vertices used to initialize a polygon must be coplanar and form a convex shape.

member.name: F:CSharpCAD.Poly3.vertices
member.summary: Sides made of tuples of (Vec2, Vec2)

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Poly3.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{CSharpCAD.Vec3},System.Nullable{CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Color})
member.summary: Creates a new 3D polygon with initial values.

member.summary: Internal constructor. Public for testing use only.

member.summary: Check if this polygon is equal to the given polygon.

member.summary: Check if this vector is equal to the given vector.

member.summary: Check if this vector is not equal to the given vector.

member.summary: Standard C# override.

member.summary: Standard C# override.

member.summary: Standard C# override.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Poly3.IsNearlyEqual(CSharpCAD.Poly3)
member.summary: Used mostly for testing.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Poly3.Clone
member.summary: Create a deep clone of this polygon.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Poly3.Invert
member.summary: Invert this polygon to face the opposite direction.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Poly3.IsConvex
member.summary: Check whether this polygon is convex.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Poly3.AreVerticesConvex(CSharpCAD.Vec3[])
member.summary: Check whether a set of vertices are convex.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Poly3.IsConvexPoint(CSharpCAD.Vec3,CSharpCAD.Vec3,CSharpCAD.Vec3,CSharpCAD.Vec3)
member.summary: Calculate whether three points form a convex corner.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Poly3.Area
member.summary: Measure the area of this polygon.
member.remarks: @see 2000 softSurfer http://geomalgorithms.com

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Poly3.BoundingBox
member.summary: Measure the bounding box of this polygon.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Poly3.BoundingSphere
member.summary: Measure the bounding sphere of the given polygon.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Poly3.SignedVolume
member.summary: Measure the signed volume of the given polygon, which must be convex.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Poly3.Plane
member.summary: The plane of this polygon.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Poly3.ToPoints
member.summary: Return the given polygon as a list of points.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Poly3.Transform(CSharpCAD.Mat4)
member.summary: Transform the given polygon using the given matrix.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Poly3.Validate
member.summary: Determine if this object is a valid polygon.
member.remarks:
Checks for valid data structure, convex polygons, and duplicate points.
**If the geometry is not valid, an exception will be thrown with details of the geometry error.**

member.name: T:CSharpCAD.CSCAD
member.summary: CSCAD contains the static methods most commonly used in producing geometries.

members.member: Serialize the give objects (geometry) to AMF source data (XML).

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.SerializeToSVG(CSharpCAD.Geometry)
member.summary: Serializer of JSCAD geometries to SVG source (XML).
member.remarks: The serialization of the following geometries are possible. - serialization of 2D geometry (geom2) to SVG path (a continous path containing the outlines of the geometry) - serialization of 2D geometry (path2) to SVG path Colors are added to SVG shapes when found on the geometry. Special attributes (id and class) are added to SVG shapes when found on the geometry.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Intersect(CSharpCAD.Geometry[])
member.summary: Return a new geometry representing space in both the first geometry and all subsequent geometries.
member.remarks: The given geometries should be of the same type, either geom2 or geom3.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Retessellate(CSharpCAD.Geom3)
member.summary: Public only for unit testing.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Subtract(CSharpCAD.Geometry[])
member.summary: Return a new geometry representing space in the first geometry but not in all subsequent geometries.
member.remarks: The given geometries should be of the same type, either geom2 or geom3.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Union(CSharpCAD.Geometry[])
member.summary: Return a new geometry representing the total space in the given geometries.
member.remarks: The given geometries should be of the same type, either geom2 or geom3.
member.param: At least 2 geometry objects, all of the same type. (All 2D or 3D).
member.returns: The new geometry formed the union of all the geometry objects.

member.name: T:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Corners
member.summary: Specify handling of corners.

member.name: F:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Corners.Edge
member.summary: Simple straight edge.

member.name: F:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Corners.Chamfer
member.summary: Diagonal edge.

member.name: F:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Corners.Round
member.summary: Rounded edge.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Expand(CSharpCAD.Geometry,System.Double,CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Corners,System.Int32)
member.summary: Expand the given geometry using the given options.
member.remarks:
Both internal and external space is expanded for 2D and 3D shapes.
Note: Contract is expand using a negative delta.
member.param: The geometry to expand.
Delta (+/-) of expansion.
Type of corner to create after expanding.
Number of segments when creating round corners.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Offset(CSharpCAD.Geometry,System.Double,CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Corners,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create offset geometry from the given geometry.
member.remarks: Offsets from internal and external space are created.
member.param: 2D geometry object to be offset.
Delta of offset (+ to exterior, - from interior).
Type of corner to create after offseting; edge, chamfer, round.
Number of segments when creating round corners.

member.name: T:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.SliceGenerator
member.summary: Callback for use with ExtrudeFromSlices. For advanced users only.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.ExtrudeLinear(CSharpCAD.Geom2,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Extrude the given geometry in an upward linear direction using the given options.
member.param: The geometries to extrude.
The height of the extrusion.
The final rotation (RADIANS) about the origin of the shape (if any).
The resolution of the twist about the axis (if any).
Repair the slice to make it conformant.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.ExtrudeRectangular(CSharpCAD.Geometry,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Corners,System.Int32)
member.summary: Extrude the given geometry by following the outline(s) with a rectangle.
member.param: 2D geometry object to be extruded.
Size of the rectangle.
Height of the extrusion.
The final rotation (RADIANS) about the origin of the shape (if any).
The resolution of the twist about the axis (if any).
Type of corner to create after expanding.
Number of segments when creating round corners.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.ExtrudeRotate(CSharpCAD.Geom2,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Rotate extrude the given geometry using the given options.
member.param: The 2D geometry to extrude.
Angle of the extrusion (RADIANS). Default: PI*2
Start angle of the extrusion (RADIANS). Default: ((double)(0.0))
Number of segments of the extrusion. Default: 12

members.member: Project the given 3D geometry onto the given plane. The given 3D geometry object. The axis of the plane. Default: [0,0,1] (the Z axis). The origin of the plane. Default [0,0,0]. The projected 2D geometry.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Hull(CSharpCAD.Geometry[])
member.summary: Create a convex hull of the given geometries.
member.remarks: Currently, the given geometries must be of type Geom2.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Center(CSharpCAD.Geometry,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{CSharpCAD.Vec3})
member.summary: Center the given objects using the given options.
member.param: =Center along X axis. Default: true.
=Center along Y axis. Default: true.
=Center along Z axis. Default: true.
Centering occurs relative to this point. Default: Vec3(0,0,0)
The geometry object to center
member.remarks: The Z components are ignored for 2D geometry objects.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Mirror(CSharpCAD.Geometry,System.Nullable{CSharpCAD.Vec3},System.Nullable{CSharpCAD.Vec3})
member.summary: Mirror the given object using the given options.
member.param: The object to mirror.
The origin of the plane. Default: new Vec3(0,0,0)
The normal vector of the plane. Default: new Vec3(0,0,1)

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.MirrorX(CSharpCAD.Geometry,System.Nullable{CSharpCAD.Vec3})
member.summary: Mirror the given ogeometry about the X axis.
member.param: The object to mirror.
The origin of the plane. Default: new Vec3(0,0,0)

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.MirrorY(CSharpCAD.Geometry,System.Nullable{CSharpCAD.Vec3})
member.summary: Mirror the given geometry about the Y axis.
member.param: The object to mirror.
The origin of the plane. Default: new Vec3(0,0,0)

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.MirrorZ(CSharpCAD.Geometry,System.Nullable{CSharpCAD.Vec3})
member.summary: Mirror the given geometry about the Z axis.
member.param: The object to mirror.
The origin of the plane. Default: new Vec3(0,0,0)

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Rotate(CSharpCAD.Vec3,CSharpCAD.Geometry)
member.summary: Rotate the given objects using the given options.
member.param: The angle (RADIANS) of rotations about X, Y, and Z axis.
The geometry object to rotate.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.RotateX(System.Double,CSharpCAD.Geometry)
member.summary: Rotate the given objects about the X axis.
member.param: The angle (RADIANS) of rotations about X.
The geometry object to rotate.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.RotateY(System.Double,CSharpCAD.Geometry)
member.summary: Rotate the given objects about the Y axis.
member.param: The angle (RADIANS) of rotations about Y.
The geometry object to rotate.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.RotateZ(System.Double,CSharpCAD.Geometry)
member.summary: Rotate the given objects about the Z axis.
member.param: The angle (RADIANS) of rotations about Z.
The geometry object to rotate.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Scale(CSharpCAD.Vec3,CSharpCAD.Geometry)
member.summary: Scale the given geometry object using the given factors.
member.remarks: The Z point is ignored for 2d geometry objects.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.ScaleX(System.Double,CSharpCAD.Geometry)
member.summary: Scale the given objects about the X axis using the given factor.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.ScaleY(System.Double,CSharpCAD.Geometry)
member.summary: Scale the given objects about the Y axis using the given factor.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.ScaleZ(System.Double,CSharpCAD.Geometry)
member.summary: Scale the given objects about the Z axis using the given factor.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Transform(CSharpCAD.Mat4,CSharpCAD.Geometry)
member.summary: Transform the geometry object using the given matrix.

members.member: @ingroup Transforms Translate (move) the given geometry. The vector of offsets to applied to the object. The geometry object to translate. The translated geometry object.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.TranslateX(System.Double,CSharpCAD.Geometry)
member.summary: Translate the given objects along the X axis.
member.param: X offset of which to translate the object.
The geometry object to translate.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.TranslateY(System.Double,CSharpCAD.Geometry)
member.summary: Translate the given objects along the Y axis.
member.param: Y offset of which to translate the object.
The geometry object to translate.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.TranslateZ(System.Double,CSharpCAD.Geometry)
member.summary: Translate the given objects along the Z axis.
member.param: Z offset of which to translate the object.
The geometry object to translate.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Circle(System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Nullable{CSharpCAD.Vec2})
member.summary: Construct a circle in two dimensional space where all points are at the same distance from the center.
member.param: Radius of circle.
Number of segments in a full rotation of circle.
Begining of the rotation of the circle (in radians).
End of the rotation of the circle (in radians).
Center of circle.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Cube(System.Double,System.Nullable{CSharpCAD.Vec3})
member.summary: Construct an axis-aligned solid cube in three dimensional space with six square faces.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Cuboid(System.Nullable{CSharpCAD.Vec3},System.Nullable{CSharpCAD.Vec3})
member.summary: Construct an axis-aligned solid cuboid in three dimensional space.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.CylinderElliptic(System.Double,System.Nullable{CSharpCAD.Vec2},System.Nullable{CSharpCAD.Vec2},System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Nullable{CSharpCAD.Vec3})
member.summary: Construct a Z axis-aligned elliptic cylinder in three dimensional space.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Ellipse(System.Nullable{CSharpCAD.Vec2},System.Int32,System.Nullable{CSharpCAD.Vec2},System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Construct an axis-aligned ellipse in two dimensional space.
member.remarks: @see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ellipse
member.param: Center of Ellipse. Default: [0,0].
Radius of ellipse, along X and Y axes. Default:[1,1]
Start angle of ellipse, in radians
End angle of ellipse, in radians.
Number of segments to create per full rotation.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.GeodesicSphere(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Construct a geodesic sphere based on icosahedron symmetry.
member.param: Target radius of sphere
Subdivision frequency per face, must be multiple of 6.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.CSCAD.Rectangle(System.Nullable{CSharpCAD.Vec2},System.Nullable{CSharpCAD.Vec2})
member.summary: Construct an axis-aligned rectangle in two dimensional space with four sides at right angles.

member.summary: Used mostly for testing.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Mat4.Add(CSharpCAD.Mat4)
member.summary: Returns the addition of this matrix with the given matrix.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Mat4.Clone
member.summary: Return a full clone of this matrix.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Mat4.FromRotation(System.Double,CSharpCAD.Vec3)
member.summary: Creates a matrix from a given angle around a given axis.
member.remarks:
This is equivalent to (but much faster than):
mat4.identity(dest) mat4.rotate(dest, dest, rad, axis)

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Mat4.FromScaling(CSharpCAD.Vec3)
member.summary: Creates a matrix from a vector scaling.
member.remarks:
This is equivalent to (but much faster than):
mat4.identity(dest) mat4.scale(dest, dest, vec)

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Mat4.FromTaitBryanRotation(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a matrix from the given Tait–Bryan angles.
member.param: Z rotation in radians.
Y rotation in radians.
X rotation in radians.
member.remarks: Tait-Bryan Euler angle convention using active, intrinsic rotations around the axes in the order z-y-x. @see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euler_angles

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Mat4.FromTranslation(CSharpCAD.Vec3)
member.summary: Creates a matrix from a vector translation.
member.param: Offset (vector) of translation.
member.remarks:
This is equivalent to (but much faster than):
mat4.identity(dest) mat4.translate(dest, dest, vec)

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Mat4.FromVectorRotation(CSharpCAD.Vec3,CSharpCAD.Vec3)
member.summary: Creates a matrix from a vector scaling.
member.remarks: Each vector must be a directional vector with a length greater then zero. @see https://gist.github.com/kevinmoran/b45980723e53edeb8a5a43c49f134724

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Mat4.FromXRotation(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a matrix from the given angle around the X axis.
member.remarks:
This is equivalent to (but much faster than):
mat4.identity(dest) mat4.rotateX(dest, dest, radians)

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Mat4.FromYRotation(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a matrix from the given angle around the Y axis.
member.remarks:
This is equivalent to (but much faster than):
mat4.identity(dest) mat4.rotateY(dest, dest, radians)

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.Mat4.FromZRotation(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a matrix from the given angle around the Z axis.
member.remarks:
This is equivalent to (but much faster than):
mat4.identity(dest) mat4.rotateZ(dest, dest, radians)

member.summary: Is this matrix an identity matrix?

member.name: T:CSharpCAD.OrthoNormalBasis
member.summary: OrthoNormalBasis reprojects points on a 3D plane onto a 2D plane or from a 2D plane back onto the 3D plane.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.OrthoNormalBasis.#ctor(CSharpCAD.Plane,System.Nullable{CSharpCAD.Vec3})
member.summary: Construct an OrthoNormalBasis
member.param: The basis plane.
Right hand vector.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.OrthoNormalBasis.GetCartesian(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get an orthonormal basis for the standard XYZ planes.
member.remarks: Parameters: the names of two 3D axes. The 2d x axis will map to the first given 3D axis, the 2d y axis will map to the second. Prepend the axis with a "-" to invert the direction of this axis. For example: OrthoNormalBasis.GetCartesian("-Y","Z") will return an orthonormal basis where the 2d X axis maps to the 3D inverted Y axis, and the 2d Y axis maps to the 3D Z axis.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.OrthoNormalBasis.To2D(CSharpCAD.Vec3)
member.summary: Use the ONB to translate a 3D point to 2D.

member.name: M:CSharpCAD.OrthoNormalBasis.To3D(CSharpCAD.Vec2)
member.summary: Use the ONB to translate a 2D point to 3D.

member.name: T:CSharpCAD.Plane
member.summary: Represents a plane in 3D coordinate space as determined by a normal (perpendicular to the plane) and distance from 0,0,0.

member.name: F:CSharpCAD.Plane.Normal
member.summary: Vector normal to the plane.

member.name: F:CSharpCAD.Plane.W
member.summary: Mysterious entity, akin to + C in integrals.
member.remarks: More seriously, W seems to just be any point in the plane, not colinear with normal. We could call it NonColinearPoint, that would make things too easy.

member.summary: Create a slice from the given points.

member.summary: Calculate the plane of the given slice.
member.remarks: NOTE: The slice (and all points) are assumed to be planar from the beginning.

member.summary: Reverse the edges of the given slice.

member.summary: Transform this slice using the given matrix.

member.summary: Mend gaps in a 2D slice to make it a closed polygon.

member.name: T:CSharpCAD.GlobalParams
member.summary: Contains settings of global importance to the library.

member.name: P:CSharpCAD.GlobalParams.Units
member.summary: Units in the library are representing this real world unit.
member.returns: One of "mm" or "in" meaning millimeters or inches.

member.name: F:CSharpCAD.GlobalParams.CheckingEnabled
member.summary: Enables special (time consuming) debug checking like geometry validation.
